Sustainable Action for Vibrant Ecosystem of Gulf of Mannar Region (SAVE GOM)
What: Ecological Restoration (150 ha): Community-led removal of invasive Prosopis juliflora along with excavation, desiltaion, cleaning  of sludge, constructing the inflow channel etc., for 10 hotspots coveing an area of 150 hectares.
Nursery development and plantation of indigenous species (Pungai, Poovarasu, Neermarudhu, mangroves) (150000 saplings);
2 years post-planting care to increase survival rates

Fish Breeding Ground Rehabilitation and Tharavai rejuvenation. 
 Eco-Friendly Artificial Reefs & Fish Sanctuaries

Community Mobilization & Training
 Develop 300 youth eco-leaders (50% girls) equipped with biodiversity mapping, climate resilience, safe removal of Prosopis species and AI tools.

Awareness & Advocacy
 Campaigns using Folk Media, Theatre, Digital Outreach
Empowering Tharavai management committee towards sustainability - stucturing them into an Apex body.
Strengthen local women’s groups & fisher collectives for restoration and conservation action
Provide communication tools and visual aids for training and awareness campaigns (IEC Materials, Toolkits & Logistics)
Facilitate cross-learning with successful community-based restoration & eco-livelihood initiatives through Exposure Visits & Exchange Programs.

Technology Integration
 Create digital biodiversity maps and ecological baselines for 150 ha, ponds, and Tharavai.
Mobile App Development & Community Data Tools by participatory biodiversity documentation & monitoring by youth, SHGs, and fishers.

Environmental Education
 Biodiversity Clubs in 30 Schools - Create active student-led eco-clubs with tools to promote local biodiversity awareness.
Train 3,000 students and 60 teachers on biodiversity, climate resilience, and eco-practices.
Integrate local biodiversity into classroom learning through engaging, child-friendly resources - Posters, Eco-Games & Curriculum.

Governance Strengthening
 Document local biodiversity, traditional knowledge, and conservation practices through participatory methods.
Preparation and registration of Panchayat level People's Biodiversity Register (PBR).

Livelihood Linkages
 Linking women with the DIC (District Industrial Center, Prathan Manthri Kaousal Vikas Yojana (PMKVY), “Employment through Skill Training & Placement (EST&P)” component, urban poor can get skill training; PM Vishwakarma Kaushal Samman Yojana, and Craftsmen Training Scheme (CTS), Fishery and Agri department, Tourism development, networks and State and Central Government schemes.

Monitoring & Evaluation
 Baseline, Midline, Endline Surveys
